name: analyze-in-vitro-drug-release-kinetics
title: Analyze Drug Release Kinetics
description: Analyze in vitro drug release kinetics from biomaterial formulations
content:
Overview

This application analyzes in vitro drug release kinetics from biomaterial formulations. Built using Biomni, it fits release data to multiple kinetic models and identifies the best-fitting mechanism.

Features

  • Fits data to zero-order, first-order, Higuchi, and Korsmeyer-Peppas models
  • Calculates RÂ² values to identify best-fitting model
  • Computes half-life (t50%) and release rates
  • Generates cumulative release and rate plots
  • Provides mechanistic interpretation of release

Parameters

  • Time Points: Comma-separated time points in hours (e.g., 0,1,2,4,8,24)
  • Concentration Data: Comma-separated drug concentrations at each time point
  • Drug Name: Name of the drug being analyzed
  • Total Drug Loaded: Initial drug amount (optional, defaults to max concentration)
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

Output

The application generates PNG plots of release profiles, CSV files with data, and a detailed research log with kinetic analysis.

Use Cases

  • Drug delivery system characterization
  • Biomaterial formulation optimization
  • Release mechanism identification
  • Quality control testing
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python "prod_apps/biomni/bioengineering/analyze_in_vitro_drug_release_kinetics.py" "${timePoints}" "${concentrationData}" --drug-name "${drugName}" ${totalDrugLoaded:+--total-drug-loaded ${totalDrugLoaded}} -o "${outputDir}"

jobConfig.label: System Size
jobConfig.name: system_size
jobConfig.description: Select the configuration for the job

spec.name: timePoints
spec.label: Time Points (hours)
spec.description: Comma-separated time points when measurements were taken (e.g., 0,1,2,4,8,24,48)

spec.name: concentrationData
spec.label: Concentration Data
spec.description: Comma-separated drug concentrations at each time point (e.g., 0,15,28,45,62,85,95)

spec.name: drugName
spec.label: Drug Name
spec.description: Name of the drug being analyzed

spec.name: totalDrugLoaded
spec.label: Total Drug Loaded (optional)
spec.description: Total amount of drug initially loaded. Leave empty to use max concentration as 100%

spec.name: outputDir
spec.label: Output Directory
spec.description: Select or create a stash folder where results will be saved
